MODULE.name: NewORMModel
MODULE.MORE_HELP: New implementation of the RHOM Model. NOTE: BETA VERSION - This API has not been officially released. It should not be used in a production environment.

PROPERTIES.DESC: List of properties supported by instance of object.

PROPERTY.name: loaded
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if model is loaded.

VALUE.DESC: If data model is not a sync model.
Used when the data model is a sync model. Just syncs changes.
If the model is used only for bulk sync.

PROPERTY.name: sync_priority
PROPERTY.DESC: This number determines the order in which the models are processed and synchronised. Priority starts from lower value 1. Lower the number, higher is the priority. Default value is 1000..

VALUE.DESC: This partition is used automatically if the model is not a sync model.
This partition is used automatically if the model is a sync model.
This partition is used to store the application related information.

PROPERTY.name: fixed_schema
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns whether the model's type is fixed schema.

PROPERTY.name: freezed
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns whether the model is frozen.

PARAM.name: modelName
PARAM.DESC: Name of the model you want returned.

METHOD.name: init
METHOD.DESC: Initializes new model's instance.

METHOD.name: initModel
METHOD.DESC: Initializes model's internal DB.

METHOD.name: setBelongsTo
METHOD.DESC: Adds 'belongs_to' relationship for the model. As belongs_to method doesn't work in NewORM, Using this method the relationship can be established.

METHOD.name: getBelongsTo
METHOD.DESC: Returns info about model's relationships with other models.

METHOD.name: set
METHOD.DESC: Sets model's property to value with additional processing for :sync property.

PARAM.name: partition
PARAM.DESC: The partition to use for this model. Partitions can be used to segment the data and keep non-synched data separate from synched models.

VALUE.DESC: This partition is used automatically if the model is not a sync model.
This partition is used automatically if the model is a sync model.
This partition is used to store the application related information.

PARAM.name: sync_type
PARAM.DESC: Sets the type of sync it will be.

VALUE.DESC: If data model is not a sync model.
Used when the data model is a sync model. Just syncs changes.
If the model is used only for bulk sync.

PARAM.name: sync_priority
PARAM.DESC: This number determines the order in which the models are processed and synchronised. Priority starts from lower value 1. Lower the number, higher is the priority. Default value is 1000.

PARAM.name: freezed
PARAM.DESC: To make the model Freezed.

PARAM.name: schema_version
PARAM.DESC: This is used for data migration of the application.

PARAM.name: propertyValue
PARAM.DESC: The property names takes the corresponding property values, as mentioned above .

METHOD.name: enable
METHOD.DESC: Sets model's Boolean property to true (enables model's property)

VALUE.DESC: To set the type of model as Fixed_schema.
To load the model.
To make the model as user model.
To send all the attributes(changed/unchanged) to Rhoconnect when an object is updated.
To keep the sensitive data out of redis server.

METHOD.name: setModelProperty
METHOD.DESC: Initializes new model's field property.

PARAM.name: propertyName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property.

PARAM.name: propertyType
PARAM.DESC: The type of property. Possible values are: String, Float, integer, Boolean, Varchar, Blob. String is default.

VALUE.DESC: Overwrite client copy of blob with the new copy from server. This is useful when RhoConnect modifies images sent from Rhodes, for example zooming or cropping.

METHOD.name: getModelProperty
METHOD.DESC: Returns info about model's field property.

PARAM.name: propertyName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property.

RETURN.DESC: Returns property name,type and option in the form of an HASH.

METHOD.name: setSchemaIndex
METHOD.DESC: Initializes new model's schema index.

PARAM.name: indexName
PARAM.DESC: To define a named index on a set of attributes.

PARAM.name: indexCols
PARAM.DESC: A set of attributes which need a indexName are passed through this array.

PARAM.name: is_unique
PARAM.DESC: To make the indexCols as unique column is_unique is set to true. This will prevent inserting duplicate records.

METHOD.name: destroy
METHOD.DESC: Destroys model's instance.

METHOD.name: createObject
METHOD.DESC: Initializes model's object and stores it in the DB.

PARAM.name: attrs
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names and its respective values are passed as a key-value pair through this HASH.

METHOD.name: createInstance
METHOD.DESC: Creates model's instance and initializes model's object but doesn't store it in DB.

PARAM.name: attrs
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names and its respective values are passed as a key-value pair through this HASH.

METHOD.name: anyChangedObjects
METHOD.DESC: Checks whether the model has any changed objects.

METHOD.name: hasChanges
METHOD.DESC: Checks whether the object has any changes. Returns true when an object is created or updated.

METHOD.name: canModify
METHOD.DESC: Checks whether the object can be modified.

METHOD.name: updateObject
METHOD.DESC: Updates object's attributes in the DB.

METHOD.name: saveObject
METHOD.DESC: Saves (creates if necessary or updates if already exists) object's attributes in the DB.

METHOD.name: deleteObject
METHOD.DESC: Deletes object's attributes from the DB.

METHOD.name: deleteObjects
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all object's according to the specified conditions.It is applicable only for Fixed_schema Model.

PARAM.name: strOptions
PARAM.DESC: This HASH takes only one key-value pair for which the key is `conditions` and the value is the attribute name. For multiple attribute names, OR/AND/IN operator is used.

PARAM.name: quests
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the values as String for the attribute names passed in the "strOptions" parameter.

METHOD.name: deleteObjectsPropertyBagByCondHash
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all objects for the given Property Bag model according to the specified conditions. It is applicable only for Property bag Model.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names and its respective values are passed as a key-value pair in this HASH.

PARAM.name: strOptions
PARAM.DESC: This HASH is passed as an empty HASH.

METHOD.name: deleteObjectsPropertyBagByCondArray
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all objects for the given Property Bag model according to the specified conditions. It is applicable only for Property bag Model.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names are passed as a string.

PARAM.name: quests
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the values as String for the attribute names passed in the "conditions" parameter.

PARAM.name: strOptions
PARAM.DESC: This HASH is passed as an empty HASH.

PARAM.name: attribNamesUsedInCond
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the attribute names as string. Note: You must include the column name which is there in condition string and others.

METHOD.name: getCount
METHOD.DESC: Returns total number of objects for the model.

METHOD.name: getBackendRefreshTime
METHOD.DESC: Returns time string when the source has been synced.

METHOD.name: findObjects
METHOD.DESC: Returns array of objects for the given model queried according to the specified conditions. It is applicable only for Fixed_schema Model.

PARAM.name: whatParam
PARAM.DESC: It defines the type of find operation to be performed.

VALUE.DESC: Finds all Objects matching the 'conditions' for a specific Model.
Returns the number of Objects matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.
Returns the first Object matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.

PARAM.name: strOptions
PARAM.DESC: This HASH takes only one key-value pair for which the key is `conditions` and the value is the attribute name. For multiple attribute names, OR/AND/IN operator is used.

PARAM.name: quests
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the values as String for the attribute names passed in the "strOptions" parameter.

PARAM.name: selectAttrs
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the attribute names as string.Useful if the model has many attributes and your query only needs a few of them.

PARAM.name: orderAttrs
PARAM.DESC: This Array is formed using attribute name followed by Order direction for that attribute. Order direction: 'ASC' ascending, 'DESC' descending. Default = 'ASC'.

METHOD.name: findObjectsPropertyBagByCondHash
METHOD.DESC: Returns array of objects for the given Property Bag model queried according to the specified conditions. It is applicable only for Property bag Model.

PARAM.name: whatParam
PARAM.DESC: It defines the type of find operation to be performed.

VALUE.DESC: Finds all Objects matching the 'conditions' for a specific Model.
Returns the number of Objects matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.
Returns the first Object matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names and its respective values are passed as a key-value pair in this HASH.

PARAM.name: strOptions
PARAM.DESC: This HASH is passed as an empty HASH.

PARAM.name: selectAttrs
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the attribute names as string. Note: You must include the column name which is there in condition string and others.

METHOD.name: findObjectsPropertyBagByCondArray
METHOD.DESC: Returns array of objects for the given Property Bag model queried according to the specified conditions. It is applicable only for Property bag Model.

PARAM.name: whatParam
PARAM.DESC: It defines the type of find operation to be performed.

VALUE.DESC: Finds all Objects matching the 'conditions' for a specific Model.
Returns the number of Objects matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.
Returns the first Object matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names are passed as a string.

PARAM.name: quests
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the values as String for the attribute names passed in the "conditions" parameter.

PARAM.name: strOptions
PARAM.DESC: This HASH is passed as an empty HASH.

PARAM.name: selectAttrs
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the attribute names as string. Note: You must include the column name which is there in condition string and others.

METHOD.name: find_by_sql
METHOD.DESC: Returns array of objects for the given model queried according to the specified SQL.

METHOD.name: validateFreezedAttribute
METHOD.DESC: Validates object's frozen attribute.

METHOD.name: validateFreezedAttributes
METHOD.DESC: Validates all object's frozen attributes.

METHOD.name: buildComplexWhereCond
METHOD.DESC: Aux function.

METHOD.name: buildFindLimits
METHOD.DESC: Aux function.

METHOD.name: buildFindOrder
METHOD.DESC: Aux function.

METHOD.name: buildSimpleWhereCond
METHOD.DESC: Aux function.

METHOD.name: clear
METHOD.DESC: Very, very dangerous method - only to be used in specs!!!

METHOD.name: onSyncDeleteError
METHOD.DESC: Handles sync delete errors for the object.

METHOD.name: onSyncUpdateError
METHOD.DESC: Handles sync update errors for the object.

METHOD.name: onSyncCreateError
METHOD.DESC: Handles sync create errors.

METHOD.name: pushChanges
METHOD.DESC: Pushes all changes for the source.

MODULE.PLATFORM: WM, CE, Win32, Android, iOS, WP8

SECTION.DESC: Use method deleteObjects for deleting multiple Objects matching the conditions using OR operator in a specific Model.
Use method deleteObjects for deleting multiple Objects matching the conditions using IN operator in a specific Model.
Use method findObjects for finding the Objects matching the conditions using OR/AND operator in a specific Model.
Use method findObjects for finding the number of Objects matching the conditions using OR/AND operator in a specific Model.
Finding the objects of a specific model using SQL query statements. It is applicable only for Fixed Schema model.

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: var stdobjData = stdObj.find_by_sql("SELECT * FROM Student WHERE department = 'Mechanical'");
CODE.RUBY: result = stdObj.find_by_sql("SELECT * FROM Student WHERE department = 'Electronics'")

SECTION.DESC: To create a model's object including initialization.
To delete multiple objects by constructing an HASH of attribute and it's value.
To set an index name to a set of attributes and indicating whether it is unique or not.
Use method findObjectsPropertyBagByCondHash for finding the Objects matching the conditions given in the HASH for a specific Model.
Use method findObjectsPropertyBagByCondArray for finding the Objects matching the conditions given in the array for a specific Model.
Use method deleteObjectsPropertyBagByCondArray for deleting the Objects matching the conditions given in the array for a specific Model.
Use method setBelongsTo for establishing a relationship with the other model. It also prioritizes the synchronization of models based on the relationship established in the setBelongsTo method.
Use method updateObject for updating the attributes of an object.

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: var objData = CustObj.createObject({"name":"Chris", "age": 30, "height":170.5}); CustObj.updateObject(objData.object,{"name":"Chris", "age": 30, "height":170.5}, {"name":"Samuel", "age":40, "height":180.5}); // "objData.object contains the object_Id"
CODE.RUBY: customer.createObject({:name=>"Chris", :age=>30, :height=>170.5}) customer.createObject({:name=>"Tom", :age=>37, :height=>158.5}) data = customer.findObjectsPropertyBagByCondHash("all",{:name => "Chris"},{},[]) new_name = "Galvin" customer.updateObject(data[0]['object'], data[0], {:name => "#{new_name}"}) #objData.object contains the object_Id
